availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert P. Parker (Lyon + caldwell co. farmer)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lisetta C. Parker Parker in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on June 11, 1846. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Lyon County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Lyon County in 1860. Farmer in Lyon County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 367A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 789.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 731.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 414B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 262.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Lyon County, KY, June 1863, p. 623 of 792 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Robert Pipkin Parker (1825-1922)," Memorial # 85253751, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/85253751 (accessed March 1, 2021).
